result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa L Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report Income in Food Stamps (>$100-$5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.92(2)(b).
  • MA-Fail/Notify Circumstances [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.91(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment, if medically able.
To commit no futher criminal acts during the period of the agreement.

Comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case.   Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

To pay restitution in the amount of $14,390.47 plus 10% surcharge of $1,439 jointly and severally with Joshua Hadley. Payment shall be made to the defendants probation officer on behalf of the victim, Door County DHS. All restitution must be paid in full by not later than 30 days before 8/19/19.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLIES TO BOTH COUNTS.    Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for August 2, 2021 at 2:30 PM.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.    Defendant can petition for early termination of probation upon completion of all conditions and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action including court appointed attorney fees.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To pay restiution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.  Restitution is to be paid at a rate of $250 per month.  Joint and several with Joshua Hadley.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC.  If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.addlTxt: 3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Melissa L Hadley appeared in court.  DOC Agent Ashlan Kairys in court.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Agent Kairys advises defendant has been making payments as ordered, did make a few extra payments in 2021.  Court commends defendant on making restitution payments as ordered.  Court won't schedule another probation review hearing, Agent Kairys can request hearing if defendant is not making payments or if she feels one is needed.
Subpoena and Certificate of Service Agent Kairys  (DCSD $65)
Probation review hearing on February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:29 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Ashlan Kairys appears in court.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  DA Nordin indicates per DOC, defendant is making payments as ordered by the Court with no violations.  State requests another PRH about 6 months out to see where things are at.  Court commends defendant for making payments as ordered, sets another PRH.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Upon successful completion of probation and payment of ALL restitution, civil judgment in 16CF2 can be satisfied.
Court reporter and DA Nordin appeared via Zoom.

02:00 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared via Zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  Carol Dept. of Door County Dept. of Human Services appears via Zoom. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to revoke the DJA.  Atty Pribyl indicates defendant is no longer contesting the State's motion to revoke the DJA, wishes to proceed to sentencing today.  State questions whether defense will be requesting a PSI. Defense indicates they are not requesting a PSI in this matter. State is also not requesting a PSI.  Court grants State's motion to revoke the DJA, finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1 & 2 as charged.    Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.  Joshua Hadely makes statement on defendants behalf.  Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant make statement to the Court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond is no longer in effect.  Probation review hearing scheduled for August 2, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

State of WIsconsin appears by District Attorney Colleen Nordin via Zoom.  Defendant appears in person with counsel Attorney Matt Prybil.  State calls Brett Reetz he's sworn and gives testimony. Attorney Prybil cross examines. Melissa Maedke is sworn and gives testimony. Attorney Nordin cross examines. Attorney Prybil redirect.  Court states Defendant has not met her burden of proof.  Court denies Motion to Withdrawl Plea.  Hearing set for January 26, 2021 at 2:00pm.

01:58 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley and attorney Matthew J Pribyl appear via Zoom.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared appeared via Zoom for the State of Wisconsin. Carol Wautlet of Door County Human Services appears via Zoom.  Court reviews events in file, reviews defendant's motion to withdraw defendant's plea.  Atty Pribyl makes comments on motion.  State feels motion fails on it's face, makes statement.  Atty Pribyl responds to State's argument.  Court makes statement, grants evidentury hearing on defendant's motion to withdraw plea.   State addresses a letter addressed to the court from Woody Wodack, requests letter be removed from the court record. Court orders letter be sealed with note that letter was sealed as of today's date.  Atty Pribyl in agreement with State's request and Court's ruling regarding the letter.  Bond remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 4, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

03:31 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Pribyl indicates he was recently appointed to the case, requests time to look into this matter before proceeding. records.addlTxt: 02:43 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Nicholas Paul Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.   Defendant indicates she doesn't qualify for PD representation and can't afford an attorney on her own, requests court appoint an attorney.  Court sends petition for appointment of counsel form with defendant to fill out and file before her next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 5, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

from defendant to Judge Ehlers
Motion to Revoke DJA

12:16 PM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews conditions of deferred judgment agreement, questions where matter is at.  Defendant indicates she's being discharged on her other case, explains where she's at this this case.  State hasn't reviewed this case in almost a year, would like some time to look into it before poceeding.  State indicates they may be filing a motion to revoke the DJA as defendant hasn't complied with terms of the agreement. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 31, 2020 at 02:45 pm.

11:49 AM Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Tara Feurig present in court.  Court reviews events in file, questions how defendant is doing on probation in 16-CF-2.  Agent Feurig indicates defendant has made 2 - $100 payments since June as ordered by the Court.  Defendant advises she is working, employers slow season is October - December then picks up again in January.  Defendant explains where she's at financially, indicates she's trying to do the best she can.  Agent Feurig is new to the case, has not seen any violations by defendant since she's been on the case.   State requests extending the deferred agreement for another year, probation has already been extended in 16-CF-2   Court makes statement, extends deferred agreement for another year, sets another probation review hearing in 16-CF-2.   Bond remains in effect.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet.  Defendant enters no contest pleas to Cts. 1 & 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds basis to accept plea on Cts. 1 & 2, withholds acceptance of plea on Cts. 1 & 2, reviews conditions contained with DAGPA, approves DAGPA.   Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties if defendant would be convicted of a felony in the future.  Upon successful completion of DAGPA, State will move to dismisses Cts. 1 & 2 and matter can be disposed by written stipulation. Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 19, 2019 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Melissa L Hadley in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews Atty Clowers motion to withdraw. State withdraws their motion to join matter with co-defendant for trial. Atty Reetz requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
